data.title: Rand Paul Biography
data.meta_description: A behind-the-scene look at the life of Rand Paul.
data.text:
Rand Paul is a Republican politician known for his libertarian views. He advocates for limited government intervention, lower taxes, and a non-interventionist foreign policy.

Yes, Rand Paul ran for President in the 2016 U.S. presidential election. He suspended his campaign in February 2016.

Rand Paul is a vocal critic of the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) and has proposed alternative healthcare plans that focus on free-market principles and reducing government involvement.

Yes, Rand Paul is a trained ophthalmologist and worked as an eye surgeon before entering politics. He often emphasizes his medical background in his political career.

Rand Paul currently serves on several Senate committees, including the Committee on Foreign Relations, the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions, and the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

Rand Paul holds a Guinness World Record for the longest speech in Senate history, lasting over 10 hours during a filibuster in 2015.

He is a licensed ophthalmologist and has performed pro bono eye surgeries for patients in need.

Rand Paul is an avid supporter of criminal justice reform and has worked across party lines to advocate for changes in sentencing laws.

He is known for his unique fashion sense, often sporting colorful bow ties as a signature style statement.
